dmca.title: Attn: George Poletes
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Liz Zielske [mailto:lizzielske@hotmail.com] 
Posted At: Monday, August 14, 2006 12:40 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: Attn: George Poletes
Subject: Attn: George Poletes


Please look into the following problem.

1.) Complaining Party = Elizabeth Zielske

2.) Work that has been plagiarized = (below)

* DatingSite: IM
* Handle: vigentleman007

TheDate

Regularly uses the screen name: vigentleman007 or mrvigentleman007. Many
people are meeting mates online these days, though in my experience I
don't know if anything positive can really come from that. This one will
promise the world and deliver heartache. He comes across as a guy with
strong moral standing and respect for women. When in actuality, he is
nothing but a lying, playing, scumbag, cheater. Like most of these guys,
he claims to be so caring but really only cares for himself. Just check
out this pitch, Malakai will likely approach his victims online through
personals sites: 
(You might even find this to be familiar, I'm sure he sends it to all
the ladies). Quote: "Do you have a few minutes to read this? I'm going
to speak form the bottom of my heart. I usually don't do this and am
very nervous right now, however, very confident as well. I am never on
this site and was just bored and clicked on your name and I have to say
... I'm really sorry to bother you but you are the most absolutely
breathtaking lady I have ever met in my life! Really ... I just had to
write you and tell you about myself, because it seems like you and I are
looking for the same thing, a real person. My name is Malakai. Hello! I
am from St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. And am half Puerto Rican. I'm 6ft 2,
240 pounds solid muscle. I'm an ex Special Forces Commando soldier, US
Army. Just moved to Miami Beach, or South Beach where my condo is and my
real estate profession. I come from a very well known and good family.
My parents have been happily married for
42 years strong now and they are retired college professors. You are so
beautiful! If you gave me the chance to get to know you, I would always
honor you, respect you, and treat you with the greatest love of all. End
Quote The message continues in the same theme. I should have known if it
sounded too good to be true it probably was. The short of the story is
this guy is great in the beginning, but the minute he gets what he
wants, he is on to the next conquest and all the while will string you
along and tell you that he's busy but things are just fine between you.
Malakai had said he needed his space so I chilled a bit and would wait
for him to contact me etc. It didn't take me long to catch on to his
cheating ways online. 
Finally, one night I called to confront him about what I had learned.
Here is how that went, its the real kicker. I call his cell and get a
strange message saying the area code is wrong ... that's odd. No biggie,
I ring up his house. He obviously ins't expecting that I am calling. He
answers, "Hello?" I say, "Hey. Whatcha up to?" He says, "Chillin'." I
say, "So how are things?" And he asks, " Do you know who you called?" I
laugh, "Uh, yea, of course I do." He asks again, "Who?" And I reply,
"Malakai." He says quite simply, "There is no one here by that name ,"
and hangs up in my face. Um, hello, ladies, like you wouldn't recognize
your guy's voice ... LIke a fool I try to call back ... it rings once
and "click". LIkely he had another lady in his bed that very minute.
Just three days prior he had the nerve to ask me if I was talking to any
other guys even as friends because even though we were taking it slow we
would be monogomous to each other. Yea, right. Watch out, Miami ladies,
this dog will charm you and eat you alive.

3.) Location of plagiarized work =
http://www.bikermatchmaking.com/dont_date_him_girl_articles.htm

4.) Complaining Party Contact = lizzielske@hotmail.com or 386-682-3370

5.) A story I wrote has been stolen, copied and published without my
knowledge. I did not give permission for this content to be taken from
its original source at dontdatehimgirl.com and republished by
bikermatchmaking.com. I have never been a member of bikermatchmaking.com
and have tried to contact them directly without so much as a response. I
strongly suspect that in an effort to build content for their own
website, bikermatchmaking.com visited sites such as dontdatehimgirl.com
and copy/pasted content they found into their own site.

This does not seem legal. When I posted that story on
dontdatehimgirl.com it was with the understanding that the information
was protected ... it says so in the legal/terms of use right on
dontdatehimgirl.com. See: item #3 at
http://dontdatehimgirl.com/terms.html

6.) These are the facts presented before you and are true and accurate.

Please help me to have this removed.

Elizabeth Zielske
386-682-3370
